metadata.title: A Mac2-positive progenitor-like microglial population survives independent of CSF1R signaling in adult mouse brain

body_text.text: Microglia are the primary innate immune cells in the CNS, capable of mounting inflammatory 29 responses and phagocytosis. They can be distinguished from other CNS cell types by the 30 distinctive ramified morphology and expression of common myeloid markers including Cd11b 31 and ionized calcium binding adaptor molecule 1 (Iba1). In addition to immune functions, microglia 32 carry out a multitude of neurotrophic functions during CNS development and homeostasis 33 (Kierdorf and Prinz, 2017) . Microglia also play critical pathological roles in a wide spectrum of 34 neurodegenerative conditions, including Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, Huntington's 35 disease, and Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (Hickman et al., 2018) . A number of disease genes were 36 found to be highly expressed in microglia (Hansen et (Haynes et al., 2006) . Interestingly, 51

we recently discovered that adult newborn microglia follow a similar maturation path (Zhan et al., 52 2019), suggesting that the developmental plasticity of microglia in the adult brain might be an 53 underlying feature of microglial homeostasis (Santambrogio et al., 2001) . To investigate early stage adult newborn microglia, we also included 88 mice that were switched to a control diet for 2 days after PLX treatment (D2) (Fig 1A) . Microglia 89 from age-matched non-treated mice were used as control (Ctrl) (Fig 1A) . Similar to our previous 90 results (Zhan et al., 2019) , oral dosing of 1200 mg/kg PLX in C57/BL6J mice for two weeks 91 resulted 92.93 -96.2% removal of CD11b+ myeloid cells in the CNS (Fig S1) . Microglia in Cluster-3 expressed 135 a high level of Mrc1, which encodes the meningeal macrophage marker CD206 (Goldmann et al., 136 2016), and apolipoprotein E, the major risk factor in AD. FIGREF0.text: al., 2018), such as Trem2 (Abduljaleel et al., 37 2014; Jonsson et al., 2013) and Progranulin (Baker et al., 2006), highlighting the importance of 38 microglia in neurodegenerative diseases. 39 Unlike other CNS glial cells, microglia originate from the embryonic mesoderm and follow a 40 convoluted developmental journey (Rezaie and Male, 2002). It starts with the emergence of c-kit+ 41 erythromyeloid progenitors in the yolk sac, known as primitive hematopoiesis, which then influx 42 into the developing parenchyma via circulation (Ginhoux et al., 2010) in an Irf-8, Pu.1-dependent 43 manner (Kierdorf et al., 2013). Seeded microglial progenitors persist in the CNS and continue to 44 expand and mature until adulthood (Matcovitch-Natan et al., 2016). In general, developing 45 microglia can be distinguished by well-defined developmental intervals from the yolk sac to the 46 adult, and transcriptional programs associated with each of these stages have been meticulously 47 markers such as Tmem119 (Bennett et al., 2016) and P2ry12

FIGREF1.text: ., 2007; Mildner et al., 2007), even under conditions of acute ablation (Bruttger et al., 2015; 57 Huang et al., 2018; Zhan et al., 2019). It is thus not surprising that microglia have an extremely 58 long half-life (Lawson et al., 1992), most recently estimated to be 7.5-15 months in the murine 59 CNS (Fuger et al., 2017; Tay et al., 2017; Zhan et al., 2019). In contrast, other myeloid populations 60 such as classical monocytes have a half-life of less than 24 hours (van Furth and Cohn, 1968; Yona 61 et al., 2013), and require constant replenishment from a Cx3cr1-population in the bone marrow 62 (Fogg et al., 2006). 63 Csf1r signaling is critical for microglial survival and maintenance. Loss-of-function mutation 64 is either of its two natural ligands: Csf1 and IL-34, results in significant reduction of microglia 65 count (Greter et al., 2012; Wegiel et al., 1998). Null mutations in Csf1r remove 99.7% microglia, 66 but a few morphologically distinctive microglia near the hippocampus and piriform cortex remain 67 (Erblich et al., 2011). In addition, the Csf1r inhibitor PLX5622 (PLX) has been widely used as a 68 research tool to acutely remove microglia. While depletion efficiency varies, complete microglial 69 ablation has never been reported (Acharya et al., 2016; Huang et al., 2018; Rice et al., 2017; Zhan 70 et al., 2019). These studies suggest that the adult microglial pool includes a population that does 71 not require Csf1r signaling for survival. Remarkably, the microglial pool can be rapidly 72 regenerated after termination of PLX administration. While an earlier study proposed a hidden 73 nestin+ progenitor pool responsible for repopulation (Elmore et al., 2014), we and others found 74 that the remaining microglia were solely responsible for microglial repopulation (Huang et al., 75 2018; Zhan et al., 2019), consistent with the notion that a subpopulation of microglia exhibit 76 progenitor-like features. Our current study applied single-cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq) to 77 examine the resilient microglial population after acute Csf1r inhibition with PLX. Among the 78 PLX-resistant microglia were a subpopulation of Mac2+ cells, which were also discovered in the 79 homeostatic microglial pool yet displayed unexpected progenitor signatures. The dramatic increase of the percentage of Mac2+ 184 microglia induced by Csf1r inhibition supports the notion that this subpopulation of microglia are not derived from peripheral monocytes and are highly proliferative 188 Since Mac2 is a galactoside-binding protein expressed in many myeloid cells including monocytes 189 and macrophages (Ho and Springer, 1982), one possibility that Iba1+Mac2+ cells are over-190 represented under Csf1r inhibition could be due to monocytic replenishment from circulation. To 191 test this hypothesis, we performed lineage tracing using the myeloid specific CX3CR1-CreERT2 192 driver (Parkhurst et al., 2013) with an inducible RFP reporter (Luche et al., 2007) (CX3CR1-193CreERT2/STOP flox -RFP). One month after the initial tamoxifen injection, 98% labeled monocytes 194 in circulation are replaced by unlabeled newborn cells, whereas microglia in the brain remain 195 RFP+ due to their extreme longevity(Parkhurst et al., 2013). Using a similar labeling strategy, we 196 examined the lineage of the parenchymal Mac2+ cells(Fig 5A). We reasoned that if the Mac2+ 197 microglia were derived from circulating monocytes/macrophages that lack RFP expression, there 198 would be fewer Mac2+ microglia that express RFP after repeated PLX treatment. Specifically, 16.36% of genes were those associated with yolk sac (YS) 239 progenitors and 22.60% of the genes were those expressed in early embryonic progenitors (E1), 240 while only around 2% of those expressed in adult microglia (Fig 6D).
